notesStmt.note: This document was created as part of a class project in Autumn 2017 for the Digital Scholarly Editing module under the direction of Professor Susan Schreibman. This module is a component of the MA in Digital Humanities at Maynooth University. Team members were assigned to create a digital scholarly edition from a selection of correspondence in the Littlehales Archive collection at Maynooth University. The team members involved in the creation of the final edition are Monika Barget, James Byrne, Sin√©ad Greene, Sharon Healy, Michael Kurzmeier, and Lauren Tracy.

sourceDesc.p: The correspondence processed for this digital edition is part of a larger collection, being the Littlehales Archive collection at Maynooth University. The correspondence is dated to 1808, and was written by Edward B. Littlehales, J. Beckett and Charles Bushe.

div.p:
Lord Clancarty having represented that it was
necessary that a Certificate from two Representations receipt
of the date of the Death of Lord Clanricarde should be
transmitted to the Lord Chancellor of Great Britain I
have the honour to enclose the same to you for that
purpose. —

I also transmit herewith a Memorandum of
which was delivered to me late yesterday relative to for
Philip Geraghty who was in the Banishment Act in the
year 1798 under a different Christian name, having
been
been seen in Dublin a few days since; — Further enquiry
into the subject will, of course be made and the result
communicated to you, if considered necessary for Lord
Hawkesbury's information —

I saw Mr Trail this morning — He is in a
very feeble state but quite free from pain —

ab.p:
Copy/ Private/ 11th August 1808
Sir Edward B. Littlehales
to
J. Beckett Esqr

div.p:
Transmiiting a Certificate of the
Death of Ld Clanricarde to the
Philip Geraghty, included in the
Banishment of Act 1798 —

Acknowledged in Mr. Beckett
letter of 15th August 1808
